content: slipped stripe hat by joanne kiley a fingering weight hat that uses striping and slipped stitches to create an interesting pattern the contrast colors works very well with self-striping or variegated yarns sizes one size for adult * yarn 50g cascade heritage mc 40g blue doxie hand-dyed cc both are fingering weight needles 40 us 2 5 ** gauge 27 sts in 4 notes *if you want to make it larger or smaller you need to add or subtract 10 sts **i used the magic loop method but you can use dpn s or a smaller length needle pattern with mc using chinese waitress or your favorite stretchy cast on 120 join in round and mark beginning of round with a marker work in 1x1 rib for 12 row round 1 mc k around round 2 cc k9 sl next st purlwise repeat this all the way around repeat rounds 1 and 2 until hat measures 7 507 broadway street sheboygan falls wi 53085 * 920 467 9978 decreases your decreases will be run along the mc line of slipped stitches to form an interesting crown round 1 mc k8 k2tog repeat this around round 2 cc k8 sl 1 repeat this around round 3 mc k7 k2tog repeat this around round 4 cc k7 sl 1 repeat this around round 5 mc k6 k2tog repeat this around round 6 cc k6 sl 1 repeat this around round 7 mc k5 k2tog repeat this around round 8 cc k5 sl 1 repeat this around round 9 mc k4 k2tog repeat this around round 10 cc k4 sl 1 repeat this around round 11 mc k3 k2tog repeat this around round 12 cc k3 sl 1 repeat this around round 13 mc k2 k2tog repeat this around round 14 cc k2 sl 1 repeat this around round 15 mc k1 k2tog repeat this around round 16 cc k1 sl 1 repeat this around round 17 mc k2tog repeat this around finishing cut yarn leaving an 18 tail using a tapestry needle pull through all loops on needle tighten and fasten_off weave in all ends
